name: Tungsten
educationalNotes: Tungsten has highest melting point of all elements (3,422°C) - used in light bulb filaments! Filament glows white-hot without melting for thousands of hours. Tungsten carbide is extremely hard - drill bits, cutting tools. Tungsten alloys used in military armor-piercing ammunition and weights. Discovered in 1783. Name from Swedish 'tung sten' (heavy stone). Tungsten-186 radioactive (very long half-life). Density high - used as radiation shield.

diffusion.usage: Sum atomic contributions for compound Σv, then: D_AB = 0.00143×T^1.75 / (P × M_AB^0.5 × (Σv_A^(1/3) + Σv_B^(1/3))²)
